parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Disable the ability to talk to other people.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unitName '''disableConversation''' disable

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unitName: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> disable: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value>[[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[disableConversation]] [[true]]</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>soldier1 [[disableConversation]] [[true]]</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setSpeaker]], [[enableRadio]], [[enableSentences]], [[showSubtitles]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 10, 2009 - 23:28 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Note that this will also prevent you from using group radio.<br>
If you just want player unable to speak to others (or one particular soldier),<br>
use <code>player [[setVariable]] ["BIS_noCoreConversations", true];</code>
<br>
or, for the other soldier,
<code>unitName [[setVariable]] ["BIS_noCoreConversations", true];</code>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 18, 2010 - 21:24 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
My previous note is incorrect now, you can use '''disableConversation''' and still use the group radio, at least in A2:OA !

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>


<template lineStart="1"><title>GameCategory</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma2</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>Scripting Commands</value></part></template>
